title: Juventus want Barcelona in the Champions League - Bonucci
title_page: Juventus want Barcelona in the Champions League - Bonucci | Daily Mail Online
text:
Juventus defender Leonardo Bonucci says he wants to face Barcelona in the Champions League quarter-finals.
Juve breezed into the last eight with a routine 3-0 aggregate victory over Porto, while Barca's path through the round of 16 was much more unconventional.
The Catalan side beat PSG 6-1 in the second leg, scoring their final three goals after the 88th minute, to go through 6-5 on aggregate.
Juventus defender Leonardo Bonucci wants to face Barcelona in the Champions League
Bonucci wants to face Barcelona in order to get revenge - they beat Juventus in the 2015 final - rather than one of the supposedly weaker sides, such as English surprise package Leicester City.
Bonucci told the Juventus website: 'We are among the best eight clubs in Europe and now is the time to kick on and go as far as we can.
'Leicester have been the surprise package of the tournament so far but personally I would want to meet Barcelona next. Facing off against the side that beat us to the trophy two years ago would be a huge incentive for all of us.
'After their comeback against PSG, you would have to say that of the teams left, they have the most momentum and belief.'

Bonucci has also revealed who his nightmare draw would be, as Juve seek their first European trophy since since 1996, when they last won the Champions League.
He said: 'Who to avoid? Bayern Munich. Wherever he goes Ancelotti finds a way of winning football matches, just like Guardiola. You would prefer to face a side like Bayern in a one-off final where anything can happen.'
The Champions League quarter-final draw is made at 11am on Friday.
